Make image example from an image file

Source: R/make_image_ex.R
make_image_ex.Rd

This function inputs an image file and allows for resizing, cropping, and text annotations

make_image_ex(
  file,
  destfile = "",
  crop = FALSE,
  scale = 1,
  region = "100x150+100+100",
  text = "",
  textcolor = "white",
  font = "Helvetica",
  fontsize = "70",
  gravity = "southwest",
  location = "+20+20",
  border = FALSE
)

Arguments

file

The path to the image to be modified
destfile

The specified path to the modified file created
crop

Whether to use automatic face detection or not (`automatic=TRUE` is default)
scale

The resizing proportion of the original image (0 to 1; default is 1 = original size)
region

The region to be cropped (defaults to '100x150+100+100', (width x height +upper_x +upper_y)). Only for `crop=TRUE`
text

The text string to be added to the image
textcolor

The color of the text annotation (default is "white")
font

The font of the text annotation (default is "Helvetica")
fontsize

The fontsize of the text annotation (default is 70)
gravity

The anchor point of the added text (default is "southwest")
location

The location of the text relative to the anchor point
border

Set to `TRUE` if you want a black border frame for the output image

Value

The name of the image file that was created

Contents
